intro: Acer oligocarpum, commonly known as the Chinese maple, is a deciduous tree native to China. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves that turn vibrant red in autumn. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers in early spring, followed by orange-red samaras as its fruit. It typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and prefers well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and parks.
